chest_pain.advice: Chest pain can be a sign of heart problems. Please seek immediate medical attention if the pain is severe, accompanied by shortness of breath, or radiates to the arm or jaw.

headache.advice: Headaches can have many causes including stress, dehydration, or eye strain. Rest in a dark room, stay hydrated, and consider over-the-counter pain relief. Consult a neurologist if headaches are frequent or severe.

skin_rash.advice: Skin rashes can result from allergies, infections, or skin conditions. Keep the area clean and dry. Avoid scratching. A dermatologist can provide proper diagnosis and treatment.

stomach_pain.advice: Stomach pain can indicate digestive issues. Try eating smaller meals, avoiding spicy foods, and staying hydrated. If pain persists or is severe, consult a gastroenterologist.

joint_pain.advice: Joint and muscle pain can result from injury, overuse, or conditions like arthritis. Rest the affected area, apply ice, and consider over-the-counter pain relief. An orthopedic specialist can help with persistent issues.

ear_problem.advice: Ear problems can affect hearing and balance. Avoid inserting objects into the ear. An ENT specialist can diagnose and treat ear conditions effectively.

throat_problem.advice: Sore throats are often caused by viral infections. Gargle with warm salt water, stay hydrated, and rest your voice. See an ENT if symptoms persist beyond a week.

child_health.advice: Children require specialized medical care. Monitor symptoms closely and ensure proper hydration. Consult a pediatrician for any concerning symptoms in children.

mental_health.advice: Mental health is as important as physical health. Practice self-care, maintain social connections, and don't hesitate to seek professional help. A psychiatrist can provide appropriate treatment and support.

diabetes.advice: Hormonal and metabolic conditions require specialized care. Maintain a healthy diet, exercise regularly, and monitor your blood sugar levels. An endocrinologist can help manage these conditions.

fever.advice: Fever is often the body's response to infection. Rest, stay hydrated, and take fever-reducing medication if needed. Seek medical attention if fever is very high or persists for more than 3 days.

cold_flu.advice: Common cold and flu usually resolve on their own. Rest, drink plenty of fluids, and consider over-the-counter medications for symptom relief. See a doctor if symptoms worsen or persist.

breathing_difficulty.advice: Breathing difficulties can be serious. If you experience severe shortness of breath, seek emergency care immediately. For chronic issues, consult with a physician.

fatigue.advice: Persistent fatigue can have many causes including poor sleep, stress, or underlying health conditions. Ensure adequate rest, balanced nutrition, and regular exercise. Consult a doctor if fatigue persists.

heart_palpitations.advice: Heart palpitations can be alarming but are often harmless. However, if accompanied by chest pain, dizziness, or fainting, seek immediate medical attention.
